page.title: 05HOUSING IN THRESHFIELD
page.content: The housing in{Threshfield}falls into three broad categories.In the 1st category are the houses which have been built before the{2Oth Century}and are of Historical interest.{Ling House on the Skipton side of the{road bridge was formerly the home of the{local {Besom Industry.The Old Hall Inn replaced{Threshfield Hall}but there are features of this remaining.The {Manor House}dates back to the 168O's. Most of these old buildings are centred around the{Village Green}and are built from{Limestone. {The Quarry Houses}form the second category and were built to house quarry workers in{Skyrethorns Lane. Finally the most recent developments are the{housing estates}at{Badger Gate and{Piecefields.}These have developed because most people have cars and are now able to travel to their work.
